perturbation.original_text:
PAYMENT TERMS
All Parties agreed the payment listed below are fair and just for the services being provided. Payment
to the following individual below within 7 days upon completion and handover on the Project to VAL.
No.
Name
Function
Amount
1.
Ms. Chen Weijie
Coordinator/Lead Developer
USD100,000.00
2.
Mr. Zheng Qing
Developer
USD50,000.00
3.
Mr. Gu Xianwin
Developer
USD50,000.00
perturbation.changed_text:
PAYMENT TERMS
All Parties agreed that payments will be made for services provided. Specific payment amounts will be determined based on project progress.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the itemized payment schedule, the modified text creates uncertainty about the compensation structure. While it acknowledges payments, it lacks specifics, contradicting the initial agreement on fixed amounts for each developer. This makes enforcement unclear as there's no longer a pre-agreed payment breakdown. This absence contradicts the original intent of a fixed price agreement.

perturbation.original_text:
INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS AND OWNERSHIP
All Intellectual Property during the project is owned by VAL, and will be turned over to VAL at
the conclusion of the project by Developer and after the fulfillment of all commercial obligations
by the VAL.
All rights and title to Duesey Coffee Intellectual Property created pursuant to the Project shall
belong to VAL and shall be subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement.
perturbation.changed_text:
INTELLECTUAL PROPERTY RIGHTS AND OWNERSHIP
Intellectual Property rights will be determined at a later stage.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the clear statement that all IP is owned by VAL, and replacing it with a vague statement about future determination, the revised text introduces a contradiction. Other sections may rely on VAL's ownership for project execution, but this modification creates ambiguity and undermines the certainty of IP control initially intended. This uncertainty could lead to disputes.

perturbation.original_text:
TERMINATION
VAL shall, in the event of Developer committing any breach of any of the terms and conditions of this
agreement or for any other reason considered as sufficient, be entitled to terminate this agreement by
giving two (2) weeks’ notice in writing and it is applicable only when the project is not completed. If
the customer terminates the agreement, then VAL shall compensate the Developer up to the date of
termination with a fee calculated on Pro-rata basis. Developer may also terminate this Agreement by
giving two (2) weeks’ notice in writing to VAL. It is applicable only when the project is not completed.
In case Developer terminates the agreement, it shall handover the entire project related IPR, work
done till date to VAL.
perturbation.changed_text:
TERMINATION
VAL may terminate this agreement with written notice. Developer may also terminate this agreement with written notice. Specific obligations upon termination will be subject to further negotiation.
perturbation.explanation: By removing the specifics regarding the conditions for termination (developer breach, project not completed), the pro-rata compensation clause, and the IPR handover requirement, the modified text makes the termination process vague. The phrase 'specific obligations upon termination will be subject to further negotiation' directly contradicts the initial agreement on clear termination procedures and responsibilities, creating uncertainty about the consequences of ending the agreement. This directly contrasts the original intent of clearly defined processes of termination and IPR transference
